title: Wildfire in Southern California forces evacuations: Here's what we need to know
content: Over 10,000 residents were evacuated as wildfires spread across California, consuming over 20,552 acres. The Line Fire threatens thousands of structures. Fires are also active in Angeles National Forest and Clearlake. Governors declared states of emergency amid excessive heat warnings affecting southern California and neighboring regions.
summary: Over 10,000 residents were evacuated as wildfires spread across California, consuming over 20,552 acres. The Line Fire threatens thousands of structures. Fires are also active in Angeles National Forest and Clearlake. Governors declared states of emergency amid excessive heat warnings affecting southern California and neighboring regions.

title: At least 40 killed, 60 wounded in Israeli strike on humanitarian zone
content: In Khan Yunis, Gaza Strip, an Israeli airstrike on the Al-Mawasi humanitarian zone killed at least 40 people and injured 60 others. The strike hit an area with displaced civilians. Israel claimed it targeted a Hamas command center, but Hamas refuted the presence of its fighters at the site.
summary: In Khan Yunis, Gaza Strip, an Israeli airstrike on the Al-Mawasi humanitarian zone killed at least 40 people and injured 60 others. The strike hit an area with displaced civilians. Israel claimed it targeted a Hamas command center, but Hamas refuted the presence of its fighters at the site.

title: Man pours boiling coffee on 9-month-old: Australia issues arrest warrant, international manhunt begins
content: The search for a man accused of attacking a nine-month-old baby in Queensland has intensified after he fled Australia. Identified on September 1, the suspect left the country on August 31. The infant is recovering from multiple surgeries. Authorities are working internationally to apprehend him and bring him to justice.
summary: The search for a man accused of attacking a nine-month-old baby in Queensland has intensified after he fled Australia. Identified on September 1, the suspect left the country on August 31. The infant is recovering from multiple surgeries. Authorities are working internationally to apprehend him and bring him to justice.

title: North Korea to increase number of nuclear weapons, says Kim Jong Un
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has committed to enhancing the nation's nuclear force and expanding its arsenal, as per state media reports. This follows the introduction of a new platform for more powerful intercontinental ballistic missiles. Kim highlighted that regional military alliances developing nuclear capabilities pose a grave threat, pushing North Korea to fortify its military strength.
summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has committed to enhancing the nation's nuclear force and expanding its arsenal, as per state media reports. This follows the introduction of a new platform for more powerful intercontinental ballistic missiles. Kim highlighted that regional military alliances developing nuclear capabilities pose a grave threat, pushing North Korea to fortify its military strength.

title: Typhoon Yagi's wrath: Vietnam's Phong Chau bridge crumbles into Red River, collapse caught on camera
content: The collapse of Phong Chau Bridge in northern Vietnam due to Super Typhoon Yagi has resulted in significant casualties and ongoing rescue efforts. Over 60 lives have been lost, and authorities are searching for 13 missing individuals as the military constructs a temporary bridge. The landslides had killed at least 44 people.
summary: The collapse of Phong Chau Bridge in northern Vietnam due to Super Typhoon Yagi has resulted in significant casualties and ongoing rescue efforts. Over 60 lives have been lost, and authorities are searching for 13 missing individuals as the military constructs a temporary bridge. The landslides had killed at least 44 people.

title: How did 358 migrants end up using same California address for US entry
content: An independent report from the Department of Homeland Security’s Office of the Inspector General found that more than 350 immigrants listed a single California address as their final destination using the CBP One app. The report highlights security vulnerabilities in the app, which has processed over 765,000 appointments since its launch.
summary: An independent report from the Department of Homeland Security’s Office of the Inspector General found that more than 350 immigrants listed a single California address as their final destination using the CBP One app. The report highlights security vulnerabilities in the app, which has processed over 765,000 appointments since its launch.

title: Harris vs Trump: What to expect, when and where to watch key US presidential debate
content: The United States is gearing up for a second general election debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump after President Joe Biden withdrew from the race, endorsing Harris. Scheduled for September 11 at Philadelphia's National Constitution Center, the debate will be moderated by ABC News with specific rules on microphone usage and questioning.
summary: The United States is gearing up for a second general election debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump after President Joe Biden withdrew from the race, endorsing Harris. Scheduled for September 11 at Philadelphia's National Constitution Center, the debate will be moderated by ABC News with specific rules on microphone usage and questioning.

title: White Stripes sues Trump over use of iconic song 'Seven Nation Army' in campaign video: 'This machine sues fascists'
content: The White Stripes have initiated legal action against former US President Donald Trump for unauthorized use of their hit song 'Seven Nation Army' in a campaign video. The band alleges that neither Trump nor his campaign sought permission to use the song, which was featured in a social media post of Trump boarding a plane.
summary: The White Stripes have initiated legal action against former US President Donald Trump for unauthorized use of their hit song 'Seven Nation Army' in a campaign video. The band alleges that neither Trump nor his campaign sought permission to use the song, which was featured in a social media post of Trump boarding a plane.

title: Who was James Earl Jones? 5 key facts about the man behind iconic Darth Vader voice and trailblazing actor
content: James Earl Jones, famed for his distinctive voice and powerful acting, died at 93. He voiced Darth Vader in Star Wars, followed his father's acting path, became the first Black actor to portray a U.S. president in film history, and delved into primal therapy.
summary: James Earl Jones, famed for his distinctive voice and powerful acting, died at 93. He voiced Darth Vader in Star Wars, followed his father's acting path, became the first Black actor to portray a U.S. president in film history, and delved into primal therapy.

title: US elections 2024: Harris leads national polls ahead of key debate, but Trump narrows gap in swing states
content: The 2024 US presidential election sees Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump in a close race. Polls indicate Harris leads slightly, but swing states are crucial. The upcoming debate is expected to be pivotal, with both candidates vying for voter support in this high-stakes contest.
summary: The 2024 US presidential election sees Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump in a close race. Polls indicate Harris leads slightly, but swing states are crucial. The upcoming debate is expected to be pivotal, with both candidates vying for voter support in this high-stakes contest.

title: Biden will be watching Kamala Harris-Donald Trump debate in New York: 'He's incredibly proud'
content: The NYT polls which shows Trump is ahead of Kamala Harris by one percentage point came as a major upset for the Kamala Harris campaign just ahead of the debate on the ABC News. “As vice-president Harris has said since day one, we are the underdogs in this race. We have a lot of work to do to make sure we win this November, and that will require us to continue aggressively raising money," Kamala campaign said after the poll.
summary: The NYT polls which shows Trump is ahead of Kamala Harris by one percentage point came as a major upset for the Kamala Harris campaign just ahead of the debate on the ABC News.  “As vice-president Harris has said since day one, we are the underdogs in this race. We have a lot of work to do to make sure we win this November, and that will require us to continue aggressively raising money," Kamala campaign said after the poll.

title: New US antitrust trial focuses on Google's online ad dominance
content: Google is facing another antitrust lawsuit regarding its advertising technology. The justice department and several states argue that Google maintains a monopoly over online ad tech. This comes after recent court decisions declaring Google's search engine and Android app store as monopolies.
summary: Google is facing another antitrust lawsuit regarding its advertising technology. The justice department and several states argue that Google maintains a monopoly over online ad tech. This comes after recent court decisions declaring Google's search engine and Android app store as monopolies.

title: International hunt for man who poured hot coffee on Australian baby
content: Australian police have initiated an international search for a man accused of pouring hot coffee on a nine-month-old baby, resulting in serious burns. The suspect fled the country days after the incident in Brisbane. Authorities are determined to capture him and ensure he faces justice for intending to cause grave bodily harm.
summary: Australian police have initiated an international search for a man accused of pouring hot coffee on a nine-month-old baby, resulting in serious burns. The suspect fled the country days after the incident in Brisbane. Authorities are determined to capture him and ensure he faces justice for intending to cause grave bodily harm.

title: Tuesday face-off: Kamala bunkers down to prep; Trump on rally spree
content: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are preparing for Tuesday's presidential debate using different strategies. Harris is refining her responses in Pittsburgh, while Trump continues with campaign events without studying. The debate will highlight their differing approaches and visions for the country, along with underlying gender dynamics.
summary: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are preparing for Tuesday's presidential debate using different strategies. Harris is refining her responses in Pittsburgh, while Trump continues with campaign events without studying. The debate will highlight their differing approaches and visions for the country, along with underlying gender dynamics.

title: Trump claims Mark Zuckerberg told him 'I can't vote for a Democrat'; Meta denies
content: Trump said Mark Zuckerberg called him after the attempt on his life in Pennsylvania and said 'there’s no way I can vote for a Democrat in this election'. Zuckerberg said, as Trump claimed, he never supported a Republican before but this year will be different. Meta denied the claim and said Mark Zuckerberg maintains his announced position that he is not endorsing any candidate this election.
summary: Trump said Mark Zuckerberg called him after the attempt on his life in Pennsylvania and said 'there’s no way I can vote for a Democrat in this election'. Zuckerberg said, as Trump claimed, he never supported a Republican before but this year will be different. Meta denied the claim and said Mark Zuckerberg maintains his announced position that he is not endorsing any candidate this election.

title: Kamala Harris talks about debating Trump in her 2nd interview: No floor of how low he would go
content: Kamala Harris said in the upcoming ABC News debate, the first face-off between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump, she expects Trump to lie. ​"I mean, he plays with this really old and tired playbook, right? Where he, there’s no floor for him in terms of how low he would go. And we should be prepared for that," Kamala Harris said in her interview with Rickey Smiley.
summary: Kamala Harris said in the upcoming ABC News debate, the first face-off between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump, she expects Trump to lie. ​"I mean, he plays with this really old and tired playbook, right? Where he, there’s no floor for him in terms of how low he would go. And we should be prepared for that," Kamala Harris said in her interview with Rickey Smiley.

title: JD Vance speaks up for cats. Turns out it was for a 'conspiracy theory'
content: JD Vance made an X post based on reports that pet cats and ducks were getting stolen by Haitian immigrants in Ohio but police said there were no such reports. Last time JD Vance had something to do with cats, it was his infamous 'childless cat ladies' comment that he targeted at the Democrat politicians.
summary: JD Vance made an X post based on reports that pet cats and ducks were getting stolen by Haitian immigrants in Ohio but police said there were no such reports. Last time JD Vance had something to do with cats, it was his infamous 'childless cat ladies' comment that he targeted at the Democrat politicians.

title: 'Black powder': How female genitalia is mutilated for 'magic', 'love potions' in this African nation
content: In Ivory Coast, witch doctors use potions made from the clitoris of girls subjected to female genital mutilation (FGM) for power and influence. The clitorises are dried, ground into powder, and sold or traded. FGM is condemned by Unicef as a severe violation of girls' rights and a dangerous act.
summary: In Ivory Coast, witch doctors use potions made from the clitoris of girls subjected to female genital mutilation (FGM) for power and influence. The clitorises are dried, ground into powder, and sold or traded. FGM is condemned by Unicef as a severe violation of girls' rights and a dangerous act.

title: Haitian immigrants eating pet cats and ducks of residents in Ohio? Here's what happened
content: A day before the much-awaited debate between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris on ABC News, Republicans were up in arms on X claiming that Kamala Harris is responsible for illegal Haitian immigrants ravaging Ohio's Springfield. They latched on to a report of an Ohio woman arrested for killing and eating a cat -- in August.
summary: A day before the much-awaited debate between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris on ABC News, Republicans were up in arms on X claiming that Kamala Harris is responsible for illegal Haitian immigrants ravaging Ohio's Springfield. They latched on to a report of an Ohio woman arrested for killing and eating a cat -- in August.

title: Height of pettiness: Small-minded Trump seeks advantage from his large frame
content: Donald Trump insists on no artificial lifts for Kamala Harris in the upcoming presidential debate to ensure authenticity. Standing at six foot three inches, Trump towers over five foot four inch Harris. Despite no request from Harris's team, Trump's demand has drawn social media ridicule and criticism from her supporters.
summary: Donald Trump insists on no artificial lifts for Kamala Harris in the upcoming presidential debate to ensure authenticity. Standing at six foot three inches, Trump towers over five foot four inch Harris. Despite no request from Harris's team, Trump's demand has drawn social media ridicule and criticism from her supporters.
